pr_title: Adding multivalued column support in Pinot connector

timeline.message: Adding multivalued column support in Pinot connector

timeline.bodyText: nit: Else if perhaps ? I also think type and blockbuilder cannot be null by the time we get to this function.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: This block builder null check is inherited from the primitive  setValue which was being called directly and now is being called via this one. Do you think this check can be removed since i don't see a requiredNonNull check in the hierarchy?   They are directly being supplied from pagebuilder
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText:
I see, so remove the null check from the primitive setValue one ? now that it is handled here by its caller ?
Also, what does it mean if type or blockbuilder are null ? Is that a bug or perhaps it means that an output column-field has to be skipped ? I recall we do that for when creating the PQL query with some hidden column-values (like grouping without aggregation case for example in broker PQL path)
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText:
I see, so remove the null check from the primitive setValue one ? now that it is handled here by its caller ?

Good point, the primitive setValue is also being called directly at the moment to set the group-by field value. I am not sure if an array column can be in group-by. @fx19880617 It'd be great if you can clarify.

Also, what does it mean if type or blockbuilder are null ? Is that a bug or perhaps it means that an output column-field has to be skipped ? I recall we do that for when creating the PQL query with some hidden column-values (like grouping without aggregation case for example in broker PQL path)

Hmm I think even for  hidden column we set types and hidden columns wouldn't have to be added to blockbuilders? since we actually do not add them to output variables? It might makes sense to remove this check.
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, Good point @dharakk ... If an array column cannot be a group by key then we might have to fail the query during pinot pql/sql generation phase :-). I feel that we should just go ahead and forbid that, it kind of does not make much sense to group by on an array (or atleast the semantics are open to interpretation).
Also, if you think that type and blockBuilder can never be null, should we put a requireNonNull instead of removing the check ? :-P ?
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: type is coming from PinotColumnHandle and can't be null because there is requiredNonNull for type there. Although for blockBuilder i think we should keep it because they are made in PageBuilder and also there is indeed a hidden column check where for negative columnIndex we pass in null value (Although I am not sure if we would ever encounter it).
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText: Also added a check to prevent an array column becoming a groupby column
replies.author: dharakk

timeline.bodyText: Do we support nested types ? if not, lets somehow explicitly forbid it ? ie arrays inside of arrays.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.author: dharakk

timeline.bodyText: I couldn't figure out how this change to TypeManager is related. It is definitely a good change and avoids duplicating framework level information.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,29 +49,25 @@ private MetadataUtil()
     public static final class TestingTypeDeserializer
             extends FromStringDeserializer<Type>
     {
-        private final Map<String, Type> types = ImmutableMap.of(
-                StandardTypes.BOOLEAN, BOOLEAN,
-                StandardTypes.BIGINT, BIGINT,
-                StandardTypes.INTEGER, INTEGER,
-                StandardTypes.DOUBLE, DOUBLE,
-                StandardTypes.VARCHAR, VARCHAR);
+        private final TypeManager typeManager;

replies.bodyText:
This change is to json serialize/deserialize array type in the PinotColumnHandle
The type gets serialized via toString() but while deserializing it we are only looking at primitive types here and using typemanager allows us to deserialize all types, i.e. array(varchar) , array(bigint) and so on.
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText: Got it. Its a testing only change so shouldn't matter much, but this would accept a wider set of types like Maps, nested arrays etc, more so than what the connector can currently take in. Thanks for explaining !
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: Actually we may need this beyond testing, in the coordinator-worker model to pass column handles as json.
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText:
Yeah good point: We should test this PR in the explicitly different coordinator-worker mode (ie regular mode) too. (The current MetadataUtil is test only apparently)
Also what about arrays and the PinotSegmentPageSource ?
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: Added an implementation for PinotSegmentPageSource I believe the existing tests cover this change too, looking at rest of the comments.
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText: Hmm. I don't see any new tests in this PR about the segment page source multi-value support. How come the existing tests cover it ? IntelliJ"s run with code coverage is your friend :-P
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText:
Actually all the new lines are covered out of the box in the coverage report as we have an all data types check here: https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-pinot-toolkit/src/test/java/com/facebook/presto/pinot/TestPinotSegmentPageSource.java#L372
Although I don't really understand the hashcode check.
replies.author: dharakk

replies.bodyText: Added an equality check for array values
replies.author: dharakk

timeline.bodyText: Should this be in a separate test ? Like testJsonRoundTripWithArrays ?
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

timeline.message: Adding multivalued column support in Pinot connector

timeline.bodyText: Just confirming: This should be writeLong instead of writeInt ? Perhaps add a comment as to why.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText: both the numeric types handle the writeLong method and handle it accordingly. So whatever the type instance will handle or throw exception accordingly. Adding a comment (missed in this iteration)
replies.author: dharakk

timeline.bodyText: My OCD tells me we should hoist the condition outside the loop :-)
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh
